domains.title:
Item 2. Understanding students' use of generative AI
Manage and understand your students' use of generative AI in assignments to ensure academic integrity and foster meaningful learning.

Your response:
${q://QID9/ChoiceDescription/3}

Feedback: 
Innovate teaching methods with advanced AI tools. 

Tips:
  1. Your AI usage doesn't have to be increased if you develop more AI knowledge. AI is not inevitable; it does not have to be used to the largest extent.
  2. Integrate advanced AI tools into your teaching methods, e.g. as a course co-designer or chatbot as teaching assistant, see table 4 (p.30) 'Co-designing uses of GenAI to support teachers and teaching' of the 'Guidance for generative AI in education and research' (UNESCO, 2023)
  3. Foster the development of students' prompting skills by using targeted exercises and real-world applications. 
  4. Promote creativity to foster solutions for complex real-world challenges. 
  5. Focus on developing students' skills in critical evaluation of AI outputs. Explain to your students how AI works.
  6. Promote creativity to foster solutions for complex real-world challenges. 
  7. Lead or collaborate on research projects on AI in education. 
  8. Mentor colleagues on incorporating AI into curriculum design.
  9. Consider collaboration with AI developers to stimulate the creation of tools tailored to educational needs, accessible to everyone.
  10. Collaborate with AI in Education experts from your institution to enable them to help other teachers, based on your knowledge and experiences.
  11. Mentor colleagues on incorporating AI into course design.
  12. Collaborate within your team on the development of a vision on AI-use within the curriculum (and exit qualifications).

Read more:
VU Amsterdam reference(s):
  • Generative AI, Copilot and ChatGPT (VU student information)
     
University of Amsterdam reference(s):
  • AI & Assessment
  • Assessment
  • Fraud
  • Tips & Tricks
     
Other reference(s):
  • Guidance for generative AI in education and research (UNESCO, 2023)

Item 3. Consulting information on AI safety
AI systems need to be resilient and secure. They need to be safe, ensuring a fall back plan in case something goes wrong, as well as being accurate, reliable and reproducible.

Please indicate which option is most applicable to you:

options.label: "I never seek information about the safe use of generative AI tools I use in my teaching."
"I sometimes seek information about the safety of generative AI tools I use in my teaching."
"I often seek information about the safety of generative AI tools I use in my teaching."

domains.title:
I. Human Agency and Oversight
AI systems should empower human beings, allowing them to make informed decisions and fostering their fundamental rights. At the same time, proper oversight mechanisms need to be ensured, which can be achieved through human-in-the-loop, human-on-the-loop, and human-in-command approaches.

questions.text:
Item 4. Understanding data processing 
Understand how data is processed in AI systems to ensure privacy and data governance (e.g. in the context of; personalised learning, monitoring performance, instant feedback, or automating administrative tasks).

Please indicate which option is most applicable to you:

options.label: "I have no idea what happens to my data when I use AI systems for teaching."
"I have some idea for what purposes my data is processed with the AI systems I use in my teaching"
"I know how my data is processed by the AI systems I use in my teaching."

domains.title:
IV. Transparency
The data, system and AI business models should be transparent. Traceability mechanisms can help achieving this. Moreover, AI systems and their decisions should be explained in a manner adapted to the stakeholder concerned. Humans need to be aware that they are interacting with an AI system, and must be informed of the system’s capabilities and limitations.

domains.title:
Item 5. Using Generative AI in Teaching 
Integrate generative AI in your teaching to enhance learning outcomes. 

Your response:
${q://QID25/ChoiceDescription/3}

Feedback:
Revolutionize teaching practices with advanced AI tools.

Tips: 
  1. Co-organize or participate in (e.g. monthly) brainstorming sessions
  2. Review case studies on AI integration in teaching. 
  3. Co-develop advanced AI teaching tools and techniques.
  4. Conduct and publish research on AI's impact in education.
  5. Mentor colleagues on AI integration in teaching. 
  6. Structurally evaluate how (generative) AI works with you and your students and how it influences thinking and learning.
  7. Create an AI coach for  teacher development, supporting self-assessment, skill practice, and scenario simulations (e.g., addressing student needs or AI-related ethical dilemmas).

domains.title:
Item 6. Increasing educational quality
Leverage AI tools to enhance educational quality and student engagement through effective integration into teaching practices.

Your response:
${q://QID29/ChoiceDescription/6}

Feedback: 
Collaborate on efforts to develop and implement advanced AI tools that enhance teaching and learning.

Tips:
  1. Develop a continuous improvement plan based on regular evaluations and feedback from students and peers (e.g. by (co-) hosting an internal online environment.
  2. Publish your findings and reflections in news items and provide guidelines.
  3. Lead efforts to develop and implement advanced AI tools that significantly enhance teaching and learning.
  4. Publish research on best practices and the impact of AI on education.
  5. Mentor peers on the effective use of AI tools and collaborate with educational technology developers to create innovative solutions that foster educational quality.

domains.title:
V. Diversity, non-discrimination and fairness
Unfair bias must be avoided, as it could have multiple negative implications, from the marginalization of vulnerable groups, to the exacerbation of prejudice and discrimination. Fostering diversity, AI systems should be accessible to all, regardless of any disability, and involve relevant stakeholders throughout their entire life circle.

questions.text:
Item 8. Ensuring fairness and inclusivity
Be aware of possible biases in generative AI to ensure fairness and inclusivity.

Please indicate which option is most applicable to you:

options.label: "I have no idea that using generative AI can reinforce biases."
"I have some idea that the use of generative AI can reinforce biases."
"I know possible biases that the use of generative AI entails."

domains.title:
VI. Societal and environmental well-being
AI systems should benefit all human beings, including future generations. It must hence be ensured that they are sustainable and environmentally friendly. Moreover, they should take into account the environment, including other living beings, and their social and societal impact should be carefully considered.

questions.text:
Item 9. Understanding environmental implications of generative AI
Understand the environmental impact of generative AI usage. 

Please indicate which option is most applicable to you:

options.label: "I have no idea what the environmental implications are of using generative AI."
"I have some idea of the environmental implications of using generative AI."
"I know environmental consequences of using generative AI."

domains.title:
VII. Accountability 
Mechanisms should be put in place to ensure responsibility and accountability for AI systems and their outcomes. Auditability, which enables the assessment of algorithms, data and design processes plays a key role therein, especially in critical applications. Moreover, adequate an accessible redress should be ensured.

"I sometimes evaluate the effectiveness of AI applications that I use in my teaching."
"I often evaluate the effectiveness of AI applications that I use in my teaching."

domains.title:
Item 10. Evaluating effectiveness of AI applications
Evaluate the effectiveness of AI applications to ensure quality education.

Your response:
${q://QID48/ChoiceDescription/1}

Feedback: 
Start with basic evaluations by collecting feedback from students and monitoring their performance. 

Tips:
  1. Develop simple metrics to measure the impact of AI on learning outcomes.
  2. Measure the time that you spend and win by using (generative) AI.
